Class Racional

  • java.lang.Object
    • Racional

  • public class Racional
extends java.lang.Object

    Rational numbers

    A rational number is a kind of number conformed by a numerator and a denominator. Bothof them are integer numbers and the denominator can't be equal to zero.
    Rational numbers are considered a superset of integer numbers and a subset of real numbers
    For further information, contact the author via e-mail: alu0100881622@ull.edu.es
    Since:
    10-02-2017

    • Constructor Detail

      • Racional

        public Racional()
        Constructor used by default. It will set the rational number 0/1 which is the simplest way to write the rational number with a value equal to zero.

      • Racional

        public Racional(int numerador,
        int denominador)
        Constructor used when both numerator and denominator are given.
        Parameters:
        numerador - This is the numerator given.
        denominador - This is the denominator given.

      • Racional

        public Racional(Racional original)
        Copy constructor.
        Parameters:
        original - This is the original rational number to be copied.

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        toString method. It uses the a/b syntax. If the denominator equals zero, it returns an error string instead.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String / or "ERROR: El denominador no puede ser cero."

      • suma

        public Racional suma(Racional sumador)
        Addition method. It adds two rational numbers.
        Parameters:
        sumador - Second rational number to be added to the object.
        Returns:
        The result of the object plus the parameter.

      • resta

        public Racional resta(Racional minuendo)
        Substraction method. It substracts two rational numbers.
        Parameters:
        minuendo - Rational number to be substracted to the object.
        Returns:
        The result of the object minus the parameter.

      • producto

        public Racional producto(Racional multiplicador)
        Product method. It multiplies two rational numbers.
        Parameters:
        multiplicador - Rational number to be multiplied by the object.
        Returns:
        The result of the object per the parameter.

      • division

        public Racional division(Racional divisor)
        Divison method. It divides two rational numbers.
        Parameters:
        divisor - Rational number to be used as the divider by the object.
        Returns:
        The result of the object divided by the parameter.

      • opuesto

        public Racional opuesto()
        Method that returns the rational number which has the same "distance" to zero but is not the number given.
        Returns:
        The opposite rational number of the object.

      • inverso

        public Racional inverso()
        Method that returns the rational number which is the result of dividing 1 by the object.
        Returns:
        The inverse rational number of the object.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method. It creates two rational number, then shows the first one, adds both, substracts both, multiplies them and divides them, and shows the opposite and inverse of the first one.
